issue.title: When model is renamed, access to links requires extra scope

content.raw:
Pasted from #677:

Some of the internal functions, such as Base::GetByName may be confused by models with nested names.
For example, the drc_vehicle model in drcsim includes the polaris_ranger_ev model. Adding a drc_vehicle and polaris_ranger_ev model to a world causes the following error message:
~~~
Error [ContactManager.cc:238] Filter with the same name already exists! Aborting
~~~

This error occurs because the contact sensor is looking for a link with scoped name `polaris_ranger_ev::chassis`. The drc_vehicle includes the polaris mode, which caused it to have a link named `polaris_ranger_ev::chassis` and scoped name `drc_vehicle::polaris_ranger_ev::chassis`. This confuses the Base::GetByName function.

A workaround is to carefully rename models when they are included in other model files.
content.html:
Pasted from #677:

Some of the internal functions, such as Base::GetByName may be confused by models with nested names. For example, the drc_vehicle model in drcsim includes the polaris_ranger_ev model. Adding a drc_vehicle and polaris_ranger_ev model to a world causes the following error message:

Error [ContactManager.cc:238] Filter with the same name already exists! Aborting

This error occurs because the contact sensor is looking for a link with scoped name polaris_ranger_ev::chassis. The drc_vehicle includes the polaris mode, which caused it to have a link named polaris_ranger_ev::chassis and scoped name drc_vehicle::polaris_ranger_ev::chassis. This confuses the Base::GetByName function.

A workaround is to carefully rename models when they are included in other model files.
